title: Ukraine Peace Talks Set for Next Week in Saudi Arabia
summary: Negotiators from Ukraine, Russia, and mediating nations prepare for a crucial round of ceasefire discussions as diplomatic pressure intensifies from all sides.
content:
The next round of negotiations aimed at ending the war in Ukraine is scheduled for next week in Saudi Arabia, according to multiple diplomatic sources.

The talks come as both sides face mounting pressure — Ukraine from war fatigue and reconstruction costs, Russia from continued economic sanctions and military losses. Saudi Arabia has positioned itself as a neutral mediator, having hosted previous rounds of preliminary discussions.

Key sticking points remain territorial control over occupied regions, security guarantees for Ukraine, and the framework for eventual EU and NATO relationships. Western diplomats expressed cautious optimism while noting that previous rounds have produced limited concrete results.

The United States has signaled willingness to engage more directly in negotiations, with the Trump administration pushing for a deal that it can present as a diplomatic achievement.
